articles.title: An Informed Pre-Caching Strategy for Large Sites
articles.description: Pre-caching, also called cache priming or cache warming, involves preemptively putting items into the cache before they are requested by a user. Ethan shares how this can be a great way to reduce expensive computations and strain on the origin server, but notes that once a site gets to a certain scale, it requires more thought than simply keeping everything in a warmed cache.
